description: A catalogue containing definitions and descriptions of the resource types, resource attributes, and resource associations.

dictionaryInfo.description: Identification, description, and contact information for the data dictionary.

resourceType.description: Identifies the scope of the data dictionary. E.g. 'database', 'dataset', 'table'.

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > scope

description.description: A brief description of the data dictionary and its source.

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > fieldOfApplication > CharacterString

language.description: Defines the language and country of origin in which the data dictionary is written.  E.g. 'eng; USA', 'eng; UK', 'esp; MEX'.

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > language

includedWithDataset.description: Indication of whether or not the data dictionary is included with the resource.

ISO 19115-2: MD_FeatureCatalogueDescription > includedWithDataset

domain.description: A list of permissable values used to constrain an attribute's value.  A single domain may be assigned to multiple attributes in a table or database.

domainId.description: A user provided unique ID for this domain.  The ID will be used to locate the domain in the domain array.

commonName.description: A short common name for the domain.

codeName.description: The code or 'lookup table' name for the domin used in the database schema definitions.

description.description: A brief description of the domain including identification of any established sources used in creating the list of domain items.

member.description: An array of member objects that enumerate and define the valid values for a domain.

name.description: A descriptive name associated with a domain value

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > featureType > FC_FeatureType > carrierOfCharacteristics > FC_FeatureAttribute > listedValue > FC_ListedValue > label

value.description: A descriptive name associated with a domain value

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > featureType > FC_FeatureType > carrierOfCharacteristics > FC_FeatureAttribute > listedValue > FC_ListedValue > label

definition.description: A brief definition for the domain item

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > featureType > FC_FeatureType > carrierOfCharacteristics > FC_FeatureAttribute > listedValue > FC_ListedValue > definition

entity.description: Defines the structure of a discrete data object within the data resource.  The data object may be a table, dataset, or single sheet of a spreadsheet.

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > featureType > FC_FeatureType

entityId.description: A user provided unique ID for this entity.

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > featureType > FC_FeatureType#id=''

commonName.description: The name commonly used to identify this entity

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > featureType > FC_FeatureType > typeName > localName

codeName.description: The code name used to identify this entity in a database schema or application software. For spreasheets this would likely be the sheet name.

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > featureType > FC_FeatureType > code > CharacterString

alias.description: An array of quoted strings providing alternate names used to identify this entity

ISO 19115-2: FC_FeatureCatalogue > featureType > FC_FeatureType > aliases > localName

definition.description: A brief definition for the entity

index.description: An array of objects describing alternate indexes for the entity

attributeCodeName.description: An array of quoted attribute code names that together compose an alternate key set for the entity

attribute.description: An array of objects defining the attributes for the entity

commonName.description: The common name used to identify this attribute

codeName.description: The code used to identify this attribute.  Most often this will be the table or spreadsheet column name

alias.description: An array of quoted strings providing alternate names by which the attribute is known

minValue.description: The minimum range value permissible for this attribute

If the foreign key is compound key (more than one attribute compose the key) the order of the referenced attributes must allign precicely with the order and number of local attributes.
